name: Paneer Bhurji
history: Paneer Bhurji is a popular North Indian dish, often enjoyed as a breakfast or a quick meal. It's a versatile and easy-to-make recipe, where paneer (Indian cottage cheese) is crumbled and cooked with spices, onions, tomatoes, and green peas.
description: Paneer Bhurji is a flavorful and hearty scrambled paneer dish. It's made by cooking crumbled paneer with aromatic spices, onions, tomatoes, and green peas. This dish is often garnished with fresh herbs and served with bread or roti.

instructions.title: Cook Spices and Vegetables
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, let them splutter. Add onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies. SautÃ© until onions are golden. Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.

instructions.title: Add Paneer and Peas
instructions.description: Add green peas to the pan and cook for a few minutes. Then, add the crumbled paneer and mix well. Cook for another 5-7 minutes.

instructions.title: Finalize and Garnish
instructions.description: Sprinkle garam masala over the paneer mixture. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Paneer Bhurji hot with bread, roti, or as a filling for sandwiches.

tips: For best results, use fresh, homemade paneer.
Adjust the amount of chili as per your taste.
variations: Add bell peppers for extra crunch and color.
For a vegan version, use scrambled tofu instead of paneer.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish.
Garnish with a wedge of lemon and extra chopped coriander.
